com.github.nsc.de.shake.lexer.token

Class TokenInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nsc.de.shake.lexer.token.TokenInputStream

  • public class TokenInputStream
extends Object
    A TokenInputStream provides the Tokens for a Parser. It is created by the Lexer
    Author:
    Nicolas Schmidt <@nsc-de>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TokenInputStream(String source, byte[] tokens, String[] values, int[] positions, PositionMap map)
      Create a TokenInputStream giving the source and tokens

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Token actual()
      Deprecated. 
      Only use, if you need a complete Token. Use actualType(), actualStart(), actualEnd(), actualValue() & actualHasValue() instead, if you just need one of these!
      int actualEnd()
      Returns the end of the actual token of the TokenInputStream
      boolean actualHasValue()
      Checks if the actual token of the TokenInputStream has a value
      int actualStart()
      Returns the start of the actual token of the TokenInputStream
      byte actualType()
      Returns the type of the actual token of the TokenInputStream
      String actualValue()
      Returns the value of the actual token of the TokenInputStream
      Token get(int position)
      Deprecated. 
      int getEnd(int position)
      Get the end of specific token from the TokenInputStream by it's position
      boolean getHasValue(int position)
      Check if specific token from the TokenInputStream has a value (by it's position)
      PositionMap getMap()
      Getter for map (Gives back the map for the positions)
      int getPosition()
      Getter for position (The actual position of the TokenInputStream)
      String getSource()
      Getter for source (The source (mostly file) of the tokens)
      int getStart(int position)
      Deprecated. 
      Avoid using this method and use peekStart(), actualStart() instead. This method is fully functional, but it uses getValue(int), which has to loop over the complete tokens array again up to the given token position
      Token[] getTokens()
      Getter for tokens (Gives back an array of Tokens)
      byte getType(int position)
      Get the type of specific token from the TokenInputStream by it's position
      String getValue(int position)
      Deprecated. 
      This method is fully working, but it will decrease the performance of the program, because it has to loop over all the tokens again to find the value's index that should be returned
      boolean has(int num)
      Checks if the TokenInputStream has left a given number of tokens
      boolean hasNext()
      Checks if the TokenInputStream has a token left
      Token next()
      Deprecated. 
      If you don't need a Token, it is advised to use nextType() & nextValue()
      byte nextType()
      Returns the type of the next token of the TokenInputStream (and skips)
      String nextValue()
      Returns the next token of the TokenInputStream
      Token peek()
      Deprecated. 
      Only use, if you need a complete Token. Use peekType(), peekStart(), peekEnd(), peekValue() & peekHasValue() instead, if you just need one of these!
      int peekEnd()
      Returns the end of the next token of the TokenInputStream without skipping
      boolean peekHasValue()
      Checks if the next token of the TokenInputStream has a value without skipping
      int peekStart()
      Returns the start of the next token of the TokenInputStream without skipping
      byte peekType()
      Returns the type of the next token of the TokenInputStream without skipping
      String peekValue()
      Returns the value of the next token of the TokenInputStream without skipping
      void setPosition(int position)
      Set the position of the TokenInputStream
      void skip()
      Skips the next token of the TokenInputStream
      TokenInputStream skipIgnorable()
      Skips all ignorable tokens of the TokenInputStream _(ignorable tokens are tokens that can have a function in the parser, but can also be ignored (TokenType.LINE_SEPARATOR))
      String toString()
      Returns a string-representation of the TokenInputStream

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TokenInputStream

        public TokenInputStream(String source,
                        byte[] tokens,
                        String[] values,
                        int[] positions,
                        PositionMap map)
        Create a TokenInputStream giving the source and tokens
        Parameters:
        source - value for field source (The source (mostly file) of the tokens)
        tokens - value for field tokens (The tokens that the TokenInputStream should give)
        values - The values for the tokens that have values in the TokenInputStream
        positions - The positions of the tokens of the TokenInputStream (We just store the end-indexes of each token. We can calculate the start-index out of the token type & value)
        map - value for field map (The position map of the TokenInputStream)

      • getStart

        @Deprecated
public int getStart(int position)
        Deprecated. Avoid using this method and use peekStart(), actualStart() instead. This method is fully functional, but it uses getValue(int), which has to loop over the complete tokens array again up to the given token position
        Get the start of specific token from the TokenInputStream by it's position

      • getValue

        @Deprecated
public String getValue(int position)
        Deprecated. This method is fully working, but it will decrease the performance of the program, because it has to loop over all the tokens again to find the value's index that should be returned
        Get the value of specific token from the TokenInputStream by it's position
        Parameters:
        position - the position to get
        Returns:
        the token at the given position

      • getHasValue

        public boolean getHasValue(int position)

        Parameters:
        position - the position to get
        Returns:
        the token at the given position

      • has

        public boolean has(int num)
        Checks if the TokenInputStream has left a given number of tokens
        Parameters:
        num - the number of tokens to check
        Returns:
        has the TokenInputStream left the given amount of Tokens?

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Checks if the TokenInputStream has a token left
        Returns:
        has the TokenInputStream another Token left?

public Token next()

      • skip

        public void skip()
        Skips the next token of the TokenInputStream

      • skipIgnorable

        public TokenInputStream skipIgnorable()
        Skips all ignorable tokens of the TokenInputStream _(ignorable tokens are tokens that can have a function in the parser, but can also be ignored (TokenType.LINE_SEPARATOR))
        Returns:
        The TokenInputStream itself so you can do an operation directly after the call

      • actual

        @Deprecated
public Token actual()
        Deprecated. Only use, if you need a complete Token. Use actualType(), actualStart(), actualEnd(), actualValue() & actualHasValue() instead, if you just need one of these!
        Returns the actual Token of the TokenInputStream
        Returns:
        The actual Token
